hedline.hl1: One Review Ends, And Another Begins

abstract.p: Florida Health Department retains Crispin Porter & Bogusky as advertising agency for its antitobacco campaign; JM Family Enterprises's Southeast Toyota Distributors begins review for its consolidated advertising account (S)

block.p: The Florida Department of Health in Tallahassee, Fla., retained Crispin Porter & Bogusky in Miami, as the agency of record for its antitobacco campaign. Billings were estimated at $19 million for the 18-month contract. The decision came after a four-month review that had been narrowed to Crispin Porter and an agency that withdrew, Siboney U.S.A in Miami, part of True North Communications. Crispin Porter said it planned to continue with its ''truth'' campaign.
Southeast Toyota Distributors, owned and operated by JM Family Enterprises, began a review for its consolidated account, with spending estimated at $70 million.

Billings were estimated at $19 million for the 18-month contract. Crispin Porter said it planned to continue with its ''truth'' campaign.
Southeast Toyota Distributors, owned and operated by JM Family Enterprises, began a review for its consolidated account, with spending estimated at $70 million.

Ed Sheehy, vice president for marketing at Southeast Toyota in Deerfield Beach, Fla., said the account was being consolidated to find a more efficient way to handle advertising for its 27 dealer associations. The four incumbents, who have all been invited to participate in the review, are: the Moran Group in Baton Rouge, La.; McGee & Starr Advertising in Boca Raton, Fla.; Omni Automotive in Birmingham, Ala., part of the Intermark Group; and the Ft. Lauderdale office of Saatchi & Saatchi.
